meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy or damage property.
meanings.sent1: The kids were vandalising the park benches with graffiti.
meanings.sent2: The vandals were caught vandalising the school walls last night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was caught vandalising the trash cans in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a vandalising force, tearing down trees and fences.
meanings.sent5: The angry waves seemed to be vandalising the fragile sandcastle on the beach.

meanings.definition: The act of defacing or ruining public or private property.
meanings.sent1: Vandalising of historical monuments is a serious crime.
meanings.sent2: The city council discussed ways to prevent vandalism and vandalising.
meanings.sent3: The graffiti artist turned vandalism into a form of art, but still faced consequences for vandalising.
meanings.sent4: The overgrown vines seemed to be engaged in a slow, natural vandalising of the abandoned building.
meanings.sent5: The old photographs captured the aftermath of the vandalising of the town square.
